2D2.F.summary: Scandinavian Investment Group A/S invests in real estate properties in Denmark. It also invests in and operates portfolio of companies in Scandinavia. The company was founded in 1908 and is based in Herlev, Denmark.

51C.F.summary: Chr. Hansen Holding A/S, a bioscience company, develops natural ingredient solutions for food, nutritional, pharmaceutical, and agricultural industries in Europe, the Middle East, Africa, North America, Latin America, and the Asia Pacific. It operates through Food Cultures & Enzymes, and Health & Nutrition segments. The Food Cultures & Enzymes segment produces and sells various cultures, enzymes, and probiotic products that determine the taste, flavor, texture, shelf life, nutritional value, and health benefits of various consumer products in the food industry, primarily in the dairy industry. The Health & Nutrition segment produces and sells products for the dietary supplement, over-the-counter pharmaceutical, infant formula, animal feed, and plant protection industries. The company was founded in 1874 and is headquartered in HÃ¸rsholm, Denmark.

FLUG-B.CO.summary: FlÃ¼gger group A/S designs, manufactures, and markets decorative paints, wood protection products, spackling pastes, and wallpaper and tools. It also offers wood stain products, fillers, wallpaper adhesives, wall coverings, abrasive materials, brushes, and cleaning products. The company owns and operates approximately 400 stores in Scandinavia, Eastern Europe, and China. It markets and sells its products under the FlÃ¼gger, Yunik, Stiwex, and Fiona brand names to painters, paint shops, stores, and DIY-centers through local distributors, as well as through online. FlÃ¼gger group A/S was founded in 1783 and is headquartered in RÃ¸dovre, Denmark.

HH.CO.summary: H+H International A/S produces and sells autoclaved aerated concrete and calcium silicate building blocks used for wall-building in the United Kingdom, Central Western Europe, and Poland. It offers thin-joint blocks and panels for interior and exterior walls, as well as foundation blocks; reinforced elements for floors, walls, and roofs; reinforced beams and lintels; and high-insulating blocks. The company's products are used primarily in the residential new building segment. It serves housebuilders, developers, and builders' merchants. The company was founded in 1909 and is headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark.

IMAIL.CO.summary: InterMail A/S provides digital and paper-based marketing communication packages in the Nordic region and rest of Europe. It offers customer loyalty, and marketing and administrative communication solutions; and engages in relation and dialogue agency services, as well as handles and distributes campaign material. The company also provides RelationPlus, direct mail, and e-box solutions. The company was formerly known as National Industri A/S and changed its name to InterMail A/S in 2004. InterMail A/S was founded in 1977 and is based in Hvidovre, Denmark.

NVZMF.summary: Novozymes A/S produces and sells industrial enzymes and microorganisms in Europe, the Middle East, Africa, North America, the Asia Pacific, and Latin America. The company offers agriculture solutions, including crop production, and animal health and nutrition solutions; liquefaction, saccharifaction, fermentation, cellulosic hydrolysis, and process enhancement solutions for bioenergy; baking, beverages, dairy, starch, and protein ingredients for the food and beverage industry; and laundry, dishwashing, and professional cleaning solutions for the household care industry. It also provides wastewater solutions, such as additives, biogas production, industrial bio cleaning, compound removal, odor control, and system start-up solutions; and textile solutions comprising denim abrasion and finishing, biopreparation, biopolishing bleach clean-up, and desizing solutions. In addition, the company offers forest products that include bleach boosting, deinking, fiber modification, effluent control, pitch and stickies control, and starch modification products; and leather solutions, which comprise biopreparation, degreasing, and re-bating. Further, it provides pharmaceutical solutions, including lipases, immobilized lipases, and proteases for biocatalysis; and rTrypsin for cell culture. Novozymes A/S has collaboration with FMC Corporation to co-develop enzyme solutions. The company is based in Bagsvaerd, Denmark.

PCAT.ST.summary: Photocat A/S produces and sells photocatalytic technology solutions for building materials that reduces air pollution in Europe and North America. Its photocatalytic building materials degrades air pollutants, such as nitrogen oxides and volatile organic compounds when exposed to light. The company's products include NOxOFF, a formulated coating for wet concrete, bitumen roofing, and asphalt road surfaces; Photocat Garden, a concrete impregnation with photocatalytic attributes that helps in reducing air pollutants and protecting concrete surfaces; actiFLOOR, which acts as a giant natural filter for surfaces; and ShineOn, a self-cleaning product primary for windows. It primarily serves manufacturers of roofing felt/bitumen, concrete, and wooden floors. Photocat A/S has a strategic alliance with Troldtekt to expand its indoor air cleaning technology to ceiling panels. The company was founded in 2005 and is based in Roskilde, Denmark.

RIAS-B.CO.summary: RIAS A/S supplies plastic products in Scandinavia. It offers semi-finished plastic products for industries, such as building, construction, chemical, mechanical, offshore, food, furniture and packaging, and visual communication industries. The company was founded in 1959 and is headquartered in Roskilde, Denmark. RIAS A/S is a subsidiary of thyssenkrupp Facilities Services GmbH.

SIG.CO.summary: Scandinavian Investment Group A/S invests in real estate properties in Denmark. It also invests in and operates portfolio of companies in Scandinavia. The company was founded in 1908 and is based in Herlev, Denmark.

SPG.CO.summary: SP Group A/S engages in the manufacture and supply of moulded plastic and composite components primarily in Denmark, rest of Europe, the Americas, Asia, Australia, and Africa. The company develops and produces fluoroplastic coatings, and PTFE and other refined materials primarily for the healthcare, cleantech, and food-related industries. It also manufactures solid, foamed, flexible, and light-foam polyurethane products for the cleantech industry, as well as produces ventilation equipment, ergonomic mats, and striping products. In addition, the company offers thermo-formed plastic components for cleantech and medical device industries. Further, it provides injection-moulded plastic precision components for a range of industries; packaging for FDA-registered products for customers in the medical device industry; manufactures rotational-moulded precision components for range of industries; offers fenders and buoys to the maritime industry; manufactures blow-moulded plastic precision components for medical device industry; and composite solutions for various raw materials, as well as performs coatings on plastic and metal components. SP Group A/S was founded in 1972 and is headquartered in SÃ¸ndersÃ¸, Denmark.
